intro: Convolvulus azureus, commonly known as the blue morning glory, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in the early morning, giving it its common name. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and twining stems that climb or trail along the ground. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in its native habitats.
